title: Rihanna named Harvard University’s Humanitarian of the Year
text:
Rihanna, take a bow.
Harvard University announced Wednesday that the “Work” singer was named the school’s 2017 Humanitarian of the Year.
“Rihanna has charitably built a state-of-the-art center for oncology and nuclear medicine to diagnose and treat breast cancer at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Bridgetown, Barbados,” Harvard Foundation Director S. Allen Counter said in a press release.
The Barbados-born singer also created the Clara and Lionel Foundation Scholarship Program, in honor of her grandparents, to provide financial relief for students attending college in the U.S. from Caribbean countries.
Drake shows love for Rihanna by wishing her a happy birthday 
She also served as the global ambassador for the Global Partnership for Education and the Global Citizen Project, a multiyear campaign that provides children in developing countries access to education.
In December, Rihanna joined Prince Harry in Barbados as part of his two-week Caribbean tour. The two visited an HIV clinic in Bridgetown and were publicly tested for the disease in an effort to raise awareness. The two visited an HIV clinic in Bridgetown and were publicly tested for the disease in an effort to raise awareness.
Former Harvard Humanitarians of the Year include United Nations Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali, Malala Yousafzai, farmworker rights advocate Dolores Huerta, James Earl Jones and Nobel Peace Prize Committee chairman Thorbjørn Jagland.
Rihanna will receive her award on Feb. 28 at the Sanders Theatre on campus.
